attributes.additional_details:
We the undersigned urge the government to consider the disused 'Ghost' Station project.

'The Project' adds value to London's 26 disused underground stations through installation of health and safety with private investment funding appreciation of government owned assets over a term, meanwhile utilising the
historic aspects of the sites to generate revenue.

The project has invested 3 years to secure financial backing of 200 million pounds which
will be delivered to London's economy through jobs across the construction and tourism industry.

I urge the government to consider the project or to seek public opinion.

rejection.details: What, specifically, are you asking the Government to do?  Norman Baker visited Down Street in early July.
